intro: Allium bellulum, commonly known as the dwarf garlic or small garlic, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its bulbs are small and resemble garlic cloves, though they are not commonly used in cooking. Allium bellulum is native to southern Europe and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils.
